bibl.title: Eclecticism and Atticism.
bibl.note: Reproduit de: EThL 53 (1977) pp. 107-112. - Replies to: C.M. MARTINI, Eclecticism and Atticism in the Textual Criticism of the Greek New Testament, On Language, Culture, and Religion: In Honour of Eugene A. Nida (The Hague - Paris, 1974) pp. 149-156. - Neither P.S.I. VII, 792 nor P. Cairo Zenon III, 59427 demonstrates the idiom for the first century A.D.

bibl.title: G.D. KILPATRICK, The Principles and Practice of New Testament Textual Criticism. Collected Essays

bibl.seg: 145.4 P. Cairo Zenon III, 59427 P.S.I. VII, 792
G.D. KILPATRICK, The Principles and Practice of New Testament Textual Criticism. Collected Essays (Leuven, 1990) pp. 73-79.

Reproduit de: EThL 53 (1977) pp. 107-112. - Replies to: C.M.
